commitResults.messageTitle: Add greeting on launch (Level-0)
Add REPL to process user input Echoes all user commands except "bye" which terminates the program.
Update divider text This is done to customize the chatbot.
Add ability to store and list text
Move logo display string into greet()
commitResults.messageBody:
Greeting logo string is in the main function, which has similar
functionality as greet().

This groups the greetings into a single function for improved
readability in the main function.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are represented by strings stored in an array.

Functionality and data of tasks are separated and hard to extend.

Abstracting each task into the Task class allows functionality to be
grouped with data. This improves code readability and makes it easier
to add tasks related features.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused function echo()
Update code to comply with standard
Add toString() method to Task
commitResults.messageBody:
There are instances where Task needs to be printed with
the same formatting.

By using overriding toString() method, the string's formatting is
refactored to a single function in the codebase.

This reduces code duplication and enhances code readability,
allowing it to be modified from a single function in the code.
It can also be overridden by subclasses for different formatting.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for tracking three types of tasks.
commitResults.messageBody:
Task is being used to to track user's tasks.

There may be different types of tasks that users want to store,
such as todos, deadlines and events.

Three different types of tasks are added as subclasses to Task.
These classes are Todo, Deadline and Event, which has additional
properties to track additional information about these Tasks.

Polymorphic code allows us to use a single collection to store
all the user's Tasks, and use the call the same methods, thus
simplifying the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add automated text UI testing with I/O redirection
commitResults.messageBody:
Symbols that indicate status icons for Tasks are emojis, which
caused encoding errors in testing output.

The symbols have been replaced with other characters to remove
the cause of these errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update REPL to use switch statement for commands
commitResults.messageBody:
The loop uses if-else statements to match user commands. As
more commands are added, the structure starts to become messy.

Using a switch statement to match the first word allows us to label
each part of the code more clearly to improve code readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update print statement for event
commitResults.messageBody:
Expected test output was also updated to match the
updated print statement.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move Task related functionality into TaskManager
commitResults.messageBody:
Both REPL and Task related functionality and data exists in the Duke
class, making the code disorganized.

Task related functionality and data has been abstracted into
TaskManager, which manages all Task functionality, such as adding
Tasks.

By abstracting code into Task Manager, the main function is cleaned
up and related functionality is grouped into a single class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor max tasks size as a constant
Refactor command strings as constants
Refactor Duke's output strings as constants
Add error handling for incorrect inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
The program has no way of handling invalid input from users, and usually
results in the program crashing. We want Duke to handle expected invalid
user input, so that the program can continue to run. Incorrect inputs by
users are invalid commands, invalid argument length, and invalid
arguments (such as giving 'done' followed by a non-integer, or an out of
range value).

Three exception classes were added, two of which extends DukeException.
InvalidArgumentException is thrown when the user's argument is invalid,
and UnknownCommandException is thrown when the user's command is
invalid. The switch statement for handling commands has been moved to
parseCommand().

This allows us to separate the main working code from the error handling
code which maintains code readability and better follow the SLAP
principles.

A getter function was also added to get the current tasks count in
TaskManager.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Task to abstract class
Refactor error string into Duke as constant
commitResults.messageBody:
This puts all the error strings into one place in the code, making the
strings easier to modify.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update error strings in Duke
Update tests to test error handling
Divide classes into packages
commitResults.messageBody:
All classes are not under any packages, and there is a moderate amount
of files in the same directory.

This makes the code hard to manage as files and the directory structure
does not give any indication to the classes that are being used in the
project.

A duke package is created, which contains two other packages: duke.task
and duke.exceptions, to contain the two classes, Task and DukeException,
as well as their subclasses, that are being used in the main Duke
program.

This allows the classes to be organised into packages for easier
management and the directory structure gives us information about the
classes being used in the project. By grouping related classes together,
the code is easier to navigate, maintain and extend.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update runtest.bat to match new file structure
Update runtest.bat to match file structure
Update TaskManager to use ArrayList to store Tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are stored in a fixed size Array, and only allows the user to
store a limted amount of tasks.

TaskManager is updated to store Tasks with an ArrayList.

By storing Tasks with an ArrayList, the user is able to store an
indefinite amount of Tasks. It also removes the need to store the
size of the Array with tasksCount, as the ArrayList provides a
method to access the current size of the list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for deleting tasks from the list
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskManager does not have support for deleting Tasks.

A new method for deleting Tasks was added to TaskManager, which removes
the Task using ArrayList's remove method. A new command was added to
Duke, which calls the new method in TaskManager to remove the Task
at the given index.

This allows the user to remove the task, and TaskManager handles the
Tasks related functionality, while Duke handles the command related
functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add saving and loading tasks from file
commitResults.messageBody:
FileFormatException is thrown when the user's file format is invalid
Task class has an abstract method toSaveString, which is called
during saving of data to file.
loadTasks, saveTasks and checkFileExists are new methods in TaskManager
that handle the loading, saving and creation of data files.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test expected input and output
Refactor Duke to run on an instance in main
Update methods in Duke to non-static
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, methods in Duke are static, and static methods should be
avoided in an OOP application as they are considered to be procedural.

The static keyword has been removed from all methods in the Duke class.

As code has been previously refactored into the run method, and Duke
runs in an instance, we no longer need static methods and static
variables, which makes the code more testable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Ui class to deal with user interaction
Update build directories in runtest.bat
Refactor Storage class to load and save tasks
Update build directories in runtest.bat
commitResults.messageBody: This is done to include the new package that contains the Storage class

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor error strings and read command into Ui
Refactor Parser class to parse user input
Update build directories in runtest.bat
commitResults.messageBody: This includes the package containing the new Parser class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor commands into Command classes
Refactor TaskManager into its own package
commitResults.messageBody:
This makes the entry point of the program more obvious as there is now
only 1 file in the highest package directory. The imports in other
source files are also updated to the correct package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update build directories in runtest.bat
commitResults.messageBody:
This includes the package containing the new Command class and its
subclasses, as well as the new package containing TaskManager.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor creating commands into separate functions
commitResults.messageBody:
The switch statement in Parser.parseCommand is too long, and thus the
readability of the code is reduced. This also causes the function to
be lengthy.

Let's refactor non-trivial functionality of the switch statement into
its own function that returns a Command.

This makes the code more readable and adhere to SLAP principles.

Checking of validity of indexes in arguments such as done and delete is
refactored into TaskManager from Parser as it is a functionality that
should be managed by the TaskManager instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant parameters in TaskManager methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Some functions in TaskManager methods have a boolean parameter
shouldPrintMessage that decides if the output should be printed to the
user. This was previously added as loading from file uses these methods
and thus the output should not be shown to the user. However, this is
now deprecated and should be removed from the code.

This boolean parameter has been removed from methods in TaskManager that
contain it.

The removal of deprecated code leads to better readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Parser method to check exact argument length
commitResults.messageBody:
checkArgumentsLength has been renamed to checkMinimumArgumentsLength to
make the method name more descriptive.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new strings for errors when deleting tasks
Add exception to handle invalid indexes
Refactor expected/min argument length as constants
commitResults.messageBody:
Expected and minimum argument length for each command are used in the
code as magic numbers, which may confuse readers of the code.

These have been refactored as constants in their corresponding Command
subclass.

This improves readability of the code by removing magic numbers.

checkMinimumArgumentsLength and checkExactArgumentsLength has been
renamed to checkMinArgumentLength and checkExactArgumentLength to
better reflect checking a singular argument string, and to make the
variable name shorter.
